main event: A 'flaming cross' object, red in color, was sighted moving slowly across the sky at an altitude of about 5,000 feet in Tuscumbia, Alabama on 23 June 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as a 'flaming cross' and was seen for about 30 minutes before disappearing into a thunderhead cloud.
The report came from a credible source, indicated by the 'Credibility of Informant' being 'E'.
The sighting was reported by the 911st in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, and it was mentioned that the object did not appear to be an airplane.
The sighting took place during daylight hours at 1500 hours, adding to the credibility of the observation.
The report is part of Project Blue Book, which was an Air Force program that investigated UFO sightings.
